title: How to Draw a Grenade

steps.headline: Draw the basic shape of the grenade (an oval).
steps.description: You can also use a circle or other shapes to make your grenade look unique.

steps.headline: Add 5 diagonal curve lines to act as guidelines.
steps.description: Make sure that there is enough space in the top of the oval for the pin later.

steps.headline: Add 4 vertical curve lines to act as another guideline.
Add a square or a rectangle shape at the top of the oval.
Add another rectangle on the top and a triangle pointing downwards.
Add a circle that will serve as the pin of the grenade.
Follow the guidelines and add the details.
steps.description: If preferred, ink in your work. Note that the grenade has several curve parts in the side.

steps.headline: Erase the stray pencil marks and the unwanted lines.
Don't forget that a grenade is made up of metal.
steps.description: Make it more realistic by adding highlights and shadows.

text: Draw the basic shape of the grenade (an oval). You can also use a circle or other shapes to make your grenade look unique. Add 5 diagonal curve lines to act as guidelines. Make sure that there is enough space in the top of the oval for the pin later. Add 4 vertical curve lines to act as another guideline.  Add a square or a rectangle shape at the top of the oval.  Add another rectangle on the top and a triangle pointing downwards.  Add a circle that will serve as the pin of the grenade.  Follow the guidelines and add the details. If preferred, ink in your work. Note that the grenade has several curve parts in the side. Erase the stray pencil marks and the unwanted lines.  Color your work.  Don't forget that a grenade is made up of metal. Make it more realistic by adding highlights and shadows.
